info.title: Cortex SDK API
info.description: REST APIs for Cortex AI retrieval engine

post.description:
Upload raw text or markdown content for ingestion.
Supports both single and batch uploads via the contents list in the request.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist
Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Upload structured sources generated by first-party or third-party apps.
Supports both single and batch uploads.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Check the current processing status of your uploaded content.

This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of documents, text, or other content you've uploaded. Simply provide the file ID to see whether processing is complete, still in progress, or if any errors occurred.

Use this to determine when your content is ready for search and retrieval, or to troubleshoot any processing issues.

parameters.name: file_id

schema.description: The file ID to check processing status for
schema.title: File Id

parameters.description: The file ID to check processing status for

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Create a tenant for your account.

Use this endpoint to initialize a tenant space you can use for ingestion, embeddings, and search. Optionally include a metadata schema to enforce consistent attributes across documents.

Expected outcome

A tenant is created and returned with its identifier.
If the tenant already exists, you receive a success message with the existing identifier.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
Retrieve usage stats for your tenant.

Use this endpoint to check whether a tenant exists and view core metrics like total indexed objects and vector dimension. This helps you validate setup and monitor ingestion.

Expected outcome

You receive the current object count and vector dimension for the tenant.
If the tenant does not exist, you get a not-found error.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Create an API key, store its hashed secret in DynamoDB, and return the full key once.

Uses the shared `generate_api_key` helper from `authentication.user`.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Upload pre-computed embeddings for advanced similarity search.

This endpoint accepts vector embeddings that you’ve generated externally,
 allowing you to integrate with custom embedding models or existing vector databases.
  The embeddings represent chunks of your content as numerical vectors.

The system stores these embeddings and makes them available for semantic search and similarity matching.
 Use this when you want to leverage specialized embedding models or have existing vector representations.
When upsert=True, existing embeddings with the same chunk_id will be updated.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Find similar chunks using an embedding vector.

Use this to retrieve the most similar chunk IDs to a single query embedding.

Expected outcome:
- You receive the closest chunk IDs with optional similarity scores.

schema.title: Response Search Raw Embeddings Endpoint Embeddings Search Raw Embeddings Post

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Retrieve embeddings for specific chunk IDs.
Use this when you already know the chunk IDs and need their corresponding embeddings.

schema.title: Response Filter Raw Embeddings Endpoint Embeddings Filter Raw Embeddings Post

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

delete.description:
Delete embedding chunks by chunk ID.

Use this to remove specific chunks from your embeddings index when they are no longer valid or should not appear in results.

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant ID for scoping deletion
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant ID for scoping deletion

parameters.name: source_id

schema.description: Optional source ID to delete by (mutually exclusive with chunk_ids)
schema.title: Source Id

parameters.description: Optional source ID to delete by (mutually exclusive with chunk_ids)

parameters.name: chunk_ids

schema.description: Optional list of chunk IDs to delete (mutually exclusive with source_id)
schema.title: Chunk Ids

parameters.description: Optional list of chunk IDs to delete (mutually exclusive with source_id)

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
Retrieve all sources for a specific tenant and subtenant combination.

Use this endpoint to fetch a complete list of all sources associated
with your tenant. This includes documents, files, and other content
you've uploaded for processing.

You can optionally specify a sub-tenant to narrow down the results to
sources within that specific sub-tenant scope.

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Retrieve specific sources by their IDs.

Use this endpoint to fetch one or more sources by providing their
unique identifiers. This is useful when you need detailed information
about specific documents or content you've previously uploaded.

Provide the source IDs in the request body along with your tenant
information to get the exact sources you need.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
Retrieve relations for a specific source.

Use this endpoint to fetch all relations associated with a specific source.
 This is useful when you need to understand the relationships between entities within a source.

Provide the source ID in the request body along with your tenant information to get the relations for that source.

parameters.name: source_id

schema.description: The source ID to fetch relations for
schema.title: Source Id

parameters.description: The source ID to fetch relations for

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Remove documents and content from your knowledge base.

This endpoint permanently deletes the specified sources from your knowledge base.
 Once deleted, the content will no longer be available for search or retrieval.

Use this carefully as the action cannot be undone. The system will confirm successful deletion of each source ID you specify.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Fetch the content of a source ingested.

This endpoint can return:
- File content directly (as string or base64)
- A presigned URL to access the file
- Both content and presigned URL

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Search for relevant content within your indexed sources or user memories.
    
    Results are ranked by relevance and can be customized with parameters like 
    result limits, alpha weighting, and recency preferences.
    
    Use `search_mode` to specify what to search:
    - "sources" (default): Search over indexed documents
    - "memories": Search over user memories (uses inferred content)
    
    Use `mode` to control retrieval quality:
    - "fast" (default): Single query, faster response
    - "accurate": Multi-query generation with reranking, higher quality

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

429.description: Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded

post.description:
Perform full text search for exact matches within your indexed sources or memories.
    Choose between 'OR' and 'AND' operators to control how search terms are combined
    for precise text matching.
    
    Use `search_mode` to specify what to search:
    - "sources" (default): Search over indexed documents
    - "memories": Search over user memories

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

429.description: Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded

post.description:
Ask a question and get an AI-generated answer based on your indexed sources or memories.

    The response includes both the AI answer and the source chunks used to generate it,
    enabling full transparency and citation capabilities.

    Use `search_mode` to specify what to search:
    - "sources" (default): Search over indexed documents
    - "memories": Search over user memories

    Use `mode` to control retrieval quality:
    - "fast" (default): Single query, faster response
    - "accurate": Multi-query generation with reranking, higher quality

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

429.description: Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded

post.description:
Store new user memories for future reference.

    This API allows you to add memories in two formats:
    1. Raw text string - A single text-based memory
    2. User/Assistant pairs array - Conversation pairs that will be
       chunked as a single memory

    The stored memories will be chunked, embedded, and indexed for
    semantic search and retrieval.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

delete.description:
Permanently remove a specific user memory from storage.

    This API allows you to delete a user memory by its unique identifier.
    Once deleted, the memory cannot be recovered, so use this operation carefully.

    The memory will be removed from your tenant's storage and will no longer
    appear in search results or memory listings.

parameters.name: memory_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the memory to delete
schema.title: Memory Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the memory to delete

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist
Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
List all API keys for dashboard view.

Uses Firebase authentication to identify the user and returns API keys
associated with that user.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
List all sources for a tenant/sub-tenant combination.

Uses the same logic as the existing get_sources function.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
List all tenants for dashboard view.

Uses Firebase authentication to identify the user and returns tenant
mappings associated with that user's organization.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

Example: > "{"title":"Q1 Report.pdf","author":"Alice Smith","file_id":"custom_file_123"}"

assistant.description: Assistant's response to the user message

chunk_uuid.title: Chunk Uuid
chunk_uuid.description: Unique identifier for this content chunk

source_id.title: Source Id
source_id.description: Unique identifier for the source document

chunk_content.title: Chunk Content
chunk_content.description: The actual text content of this chunk
examples: This is a chunk of text from the source document.

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: Type of the source document (file, webpage, etc.)

source_upload_time.title: Source Upload Time
source_upload_time.description: When the source document was originally uploaded

source_title.title: Source Title
source_title.description: Title or name of the source document

source_last_updated_time.title: Source Last Updated Time
source_last_updated_time.description: When the source document was last modified

layout.title: Layout
layout.description: Layout of the chunk in original document. You will generally receive        a stringified dict with 2 keys, `offsets` and `page`(optional). Offsets will have        `document_level_start_index` and `page_level_start_index`(optional)

relevancy_score.title: Relevancy Score
relevancy_score.description: Score indicating how relevant this chunk is to your search query,         with higher values indicating better matches

document_metadata.title: Document Metadata
document_metadata.description: Metadata extracted from the source document

tenant_metadata.title: Tenant Metadata
tenant_metadata.description: Custom metadata associated with your tenant
